sentence.Network_en: the discursive style of the novel
His own toast was discursive and overlong, though rather touching.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from medieval Latin discursivus, from Latin discurs-, literally 'gone hastily to and fro', from the verb discurrere (see discourse)

entry.tran: 离题的;东拉西扯的;不着边际的
entry.def: If a style of writing is discursive, it includes a lot of facts or opinions that are not necessarily relevant.

example.ex: ...a livelier, more candid and more discursive treatment of the subject.
example.tran: 对该主题的更生动、更坦率、更发散性的论述

means.word_mean: 1. proceeding to a conclusion by reason or argument rather than intuition
2. (of e.g. speech and writing) tending to depart from the main point or cover a wide range of subjects;

sentences.sentence: "amusingly digressive with satirical thrusts at women's fashions among other things"
"a rambling speech about this and that"
